availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Rockbridge County, Virginia, native. Son of Thomas Bodkin and Catherine Burrington Bodkin. Married to Polly Taylor Bodkin. Father of Daniel Bodkin M. Bodkin, A. Bodkin, Isaac Bodkin, Martha J. Bodkin, Joseph Bodkin, E. Bodkin, and Cornelia Bodkin. Married to Catherine Morgan Bodkin. Father of Charles Bodkin, and William Bodkin. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860.
